TV is better than books because the educational programs on TV are much more convenient and easy to understand. It is also easy to use for people who cannot see or hear. argues for communal experience; specific.description: argues for communal experience; specifically, the text argues that TV is a better form of entertainment because it can be enjoyed with others, making it a more social experience. For example, 'TV is great to watch with family and friends, making it a shared experience.'

cites convenience as a factor; specifica.description: cites convenience as a factor; specifically, the text argues that TV's ease of use and accessibility make it more entertaining than books. For example, 'With TV, you can just sit back and relax, whereas with books you have to hold them and turn pages.'
texts: Yes I would say it has you relax in case your tired, but you can read to relax as well. Plus have you ever considered about the commercials and how annoying they are?
tv is far superior due to its wider variety of thing to do and some people say that tv is incontinent but now you can watch tv on a smart phone witch is very convenient
Television uses electricity and books such as harry potter are made of trees so it causes more damage to the environment.
TV is better because you can just explore the world while sitting on a couch

cites academic benefits; specifically, t.description: cites academic benefits; specifically, the text argues that TV can improve academic skills and increase innovation. For example, 'It improves academic skills of a child. Television has made children enthusiastic and confident. Children improve their academics and increase their ideas and innovations!!!'
texts: TV ,,!! because you can get information from different resources in a short time ,,, but Books you must read a lot to get that much of information !!
tv because only tv can bring u live news at books u can't find also it's educational

Some people can't even imagine so T.V. is helpful. As concerning the time limit or harm to our eyes, we should watch T.V. in a limit, because the excess of everything is harmful, even reading of books.
Surveys have found that a normal person can remember 10% of what he had read and 50% of what he had listened and watched.

mentions accessibility; specifically, th.description: mentions accessibility; specifically, the text argues that tv is more accessible than books for people with disabilities. For example, 'It is also easy to use for people who cannot see or hear.'
texts: tv because only tv can bring u live news at books u can't find also it's educational

TV is better than books because the educational programs on TV are much more convenient and easy to understand. It is also easy to use for people who cannot see or hear. Books are also likely to be not updated with latest information about a certain topic while information from TV can be much more accurate and useful.

cites personal experience; specifically,.description: cites personal experience; specifically, the text provides anecdotal evidence to support the argument that TV improves academic skills. For example, 'I have seen my child's grades improve after watching educational programs on TV.'
texts: TV ,,!! because you can get information from different resources in a short time ,,, but Books you must read a lot to get that much of information !!

It Improves academic skills of a child .Television has made children enthusiastic and confident.
Children improve their academics and increase their ideas and innovations!!!

provides statistics; specifically, the t.description: provides statistics; specifically, the text presents data or research findings to support the argument that tv improves academic skills. For example, 'Surveys have found that a normal person can remember 10% of what he had read and 50% of what he had listened and watched.'

cites research studies; specifically, th.description: cites research studies; specifically, the text references scientific studies or surveys to support the argument that tv improves academic skills. For example, 'Surveys have found that a normal person can remember 10% of what he had read and 50% of what he had listened and watched.'
texts:
I think T.V. is more helpful as the you can watch and listen to something being explained like if we read about budding or spore formation we have to create an image about that in mind, but when we watch the animation of budding then we could understand better. Some people can't even imagine so T.V. is helpful. As concerning the time limit or harm to our eyes, we should watch T.V. in a limit, because the excess of everything is harmful, even reading of books.
Surveys have found that a normal person can remember 10% of what he had read and 50% of what he had listened and watched.
tv is better than books because you learn easier by seeing not read

argues for accessibility; specifically,.description: argues for accessibility; specifically, the text argues that TV is more accessible than books for people with disabilities. For example, 'Television has made children enthusiastic and confident. Children improve their academics and increase their ideas and innovations!!!'

cites personal preference; specifically,.description: cites personal preference; specifically, the text argues that TV is better than books because the author personally enjoys it more. For example, 'I love TV sooooooo much I can watch whatever I want and it is just the best.'
